title.rendered: PROFESSIONAL AIRCRAFT ACCESSORIES TAPS FORMER DELTA AIRLINES LEADER TO SPEARHEAD COMPANY

content.rendered:
Professional Aircraft Accessories, a Greenwich AeroGroup company announced today it has hired Jonathan Clarke as its new Vice President and General Manager.

Mr. Clarke is a seasoned leader who has directed multi-million dollar production operations. He joins Professional Aircraft Accessories after a 30-year career with Delta Airlines. He most recently served as Delta’s General Manager for landing gear, engine operations and APUs.

“Jonathan is a high-caliber leader that we welcome to our team,” said Chief Operating Officer for Greenwich AeroGroup Ralph Kunz. “His extensive background in aerospace support services and his capability to lead large teams gives us great certainty that he is indeed the best person for this position.”

A self-starter, Mr. Clarke began his career with Delta Airlines as an aircraft mechanic. He gradually rose through the ranks serving in a variety of roles including regional manager, manager of the landing gear shop and product line manager for engines. In his final position with Delta, Mr. Clarke held P&L responsibility for the business unit supporting all aircraft engine, APU, landing gear production and test operations for Delta’s fleet of 800+ aircraft.

Mr. Clarke graduated from Embry-Riddle with a Bachelor of Science in Technical Management. He also holds a Master of Business Administration, Aerospace & Defense from the University of Tennessee. In addition, he is a certified Six-Sigma Greenbelt.

Mr. Clarke will begin his duties on April 15th.
